text: Donald J. Salls (born June 24, 1919) is a former American football player and coach. He served as the head football coach at Jacksonville State University from 1946 to 1952 and from 1954 to 1964. He was a World War II veteran and a Purple Heart recipient. ==References== Category:1919 births Category:Living people Category:American centenarians Category:Sportspeople from Trenton, New Jersey Category:Players of American football from New Jersey Category:American football fullbacks Category:American football linebackers Category:Alabama Crimson Tide football players Category:Coaches of American football from New Jersey Category:Jacksonville State Gamecocks football coaches
title: Don Salls
